CONFIRM.RELOAD_AFTER_IDB_ERROR:
Database Error - App Will Restart

Super Productivity cannot save data! This is usually caused by:
‚Ä¢ Low disk space (most common)
‚Ä¢ App update in background
‚Ä¢ Linux Snap users: run 'snap set core experimental.refresh-app-awareness=true'

Your recent changes may not have been saved. Please free up disk space if low. The app will restart after you close this dialog.

DONATE_PAGE.INTRO_1: Super Productivity is funded entirely by the community. There is no tracking, no ads, and no data collection ‚Äî your tasks stay on your device.
DONATE_PAGE.INTRO_2: If you value this approach and want to keep the project healthy and evolving, a voluntary donation is greatly appreciated.

FORM_SECTION.HELP:
Here you can configure Super Productivity to list uncompleted CalDAV tasks for a specific project in the task creation panel in the daily planning view. They will be listed as suggestions and will provide a link to the task as well as more information about it.

In addition, you can automatically add and sync all uncompleted tasks to your task backlog.

To make it work for Nextcloud in the webapp, you may need to allow "https://app.super-productivity.com" in the Nextcloud app webapppassword.

FORM_SECTION.HELP:
Here you can configure Super Productivity to list open Gitea issues for a specific repository in the task creation panel in the daily planning view. They will be listed as suggestions and will provide a link to the issue as well as more information about it.

In addition you can automatically add and import all open issues.

To get by usage limits and to access you can provide a an access token.

FORM_SECTION.HELP:
Here you can configure Super Productivity to list open GitHub issues for a specific repository in the task creation panel in the daily planning view. They will be listed as suggestions and will provide a link to the issue as well as more information about it.

In addition, you can automatically import all open issues.

To get by usage limits and to access you can provide a an access token. More info about its scopes can be found here.

HELP_ARR.P1_1: Please provide a login name (can be found on your profile page) and an API token or password if you can't generate one for some reason. Please not that newer versions of Jira sometimes only work with the token.
HELP_ARR.P1_2: You also need to specify a JQL query which is used for the suggestions to add tasks from Jira. If you need help check out this link https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-764478330.html.
HELP_ARR.P1_3: You can also configure if you want to automatically (e.g. every time you visit the planning view), to import all new issues specified by a custom JQL query.
HELP_ARR.P1_4: Another option is "Check if current ticket is assigned to current user". If enabled and you're starting, a check will be made to ensure you're currently assigned to that ticket on Jira. If not, a dialog appears in which you can chose to assign the ticket to yourself.
HELP_ARR.P2_1: There are several options to determine when and how you want to submit a worklog. Enabling 'Open worklog dialog for adding a worklog to Jira when task is completed' opens a dialog to add an worklog every time you mark a Jira Task as completed. So keep in mind that worklogs will be added on top of everything tracked so far. If you mark a task as completed for a second time, you may not want to submit the complete worked time for the task again.
HELP_ARR.P2_2: 'Open worklog dialog when subtask is completed and not for tasks with subtasks themselves' opens a worklog dialog every time when you mark a subtask of a Jira issue as completed. Because you already track your time via the subtasks, no dialog is opened once you mark the Jira task itself as completed.
HELP_ARR.P2_3: 'Send updates to worklog automatically without dialog' does what it says. Because marking a task as completed several times leads to the whole worked time being tracked twice, this is not recommended.
HELP_ARR.P3_1: Here you can reconfigure your default transitions. Jira enables a wide configuration of transitions usually coming into action as different columns on your Jira agile board we can't make assumptions about where and when to transition your tasks and you need to set it manually.

EVAL_FORM.DAILY_STATE_TOOLTIP: Quadrant system based on both scores (‚â•50 is high): Deep Flow (high/high), Overdrive (high/low), Recovery (low/high), Drift (low/low)
EVAL_FORM.IMPACT_OF_WORK: How do you rate the impact of your work today?
EVAL_FORM.PRODUCTIVITY_SCORE_TOOLTIP: 65% Impact (1-4 scale) ‚Ä¢ 30% Focus toward 4h target ‚Ä¢ 5% total work (capped at 10h)
EVAL_FORM.STATE_DEEP_FLOW_HEADLINE: Deep Flow: Excellent focus and sustainable pace.
EVAL_FORM.STATE_DEEP_FLOW_HINT: You‚Äôre in the sweet spot ‚Äî reflect on what made this combination possible.
EVAL_FORM.STATE_DRIFT_HEADLINE: Drift: Low focus and low energy.
EVAL_FORM.STATE_DRIFT_HINT: That‚Äôs okay. Reflect on what distracted you and adjust gently ‚Äî every reset is a chance to learn.
EVAL_FORM.STATE_IMPACT_MISMATCH_HEADLINE: Low Impact: Plenty of focus, little payoff.
EVAL_FORM.STATE_IMPACT_MISMATCH_HINT: You invested solid focus ‚Äî now direct it toward higher-impact work to feel the difference.
EVAL_FORM.STATE_OVERDRIVE_HEADLINE: Overdrive: Productive, but at a cost.
EVAL_FORM.STATE_OVERDRIVE_HINT: You got a lot done ‚Äî now make sure to recharge before burnout sneaks in.
EVAL_FORM.STATE_RECOVERY_HINT: You‚Äôre giving your mind space to recover. Tomorrow you‚Äôll have the energy to dive deeper again.
EVAL_FORM.STATE_STEADY_HINT: Nice balance. You‚Äôre keeping momentum without overextending ‚Äî keep nourishing what makes this pace work.
EVAL_FORM.SUSTAINABILITY_SCORE_TOOLTIP: 45% Energy level ‚Ä¢ 40% Reasonable work hours (0 at 10h) ‚Ä¢ 15% Focus balance (optimal at 4h)

D_INITIAL.TEXT:
The Schedule will provide you with a better picture of how one's planned tasks play out over time. It is automatically generated from your Tasks and requires only time estimates on them to work.

Two things are distinguished: Scheduled Tasks, which are shown at their planned time and Regular Tasks, which should flow around those fixed events.

If you provide a work start and end time (recommended), regular tasks will never be placed outside of these boundaries.
D_INITIAL.TITLE: Schedule

D_CONFLICT.OVERWRITE_WARNING: WARNING: The {{targetName}} data contains approximately {{targetChanges}} changes while the {{sourceName}} data only has {{sourceChanges}} changes. Are you sure you want to overwrite the {{targetName}} data with the {{sourceName}} version? This action cannot be undone.
D_CONFLICT.TEXT: Update from remote. Both local and remote data seem to be modified.
D_CONFLICT.TITLE: Sync: Conflicting Data

D_DECRYPT_ERROR.TITLE: Decryption Failed
D_DECRYPT_ERROR.P1: Your remote data is encrypted and decryption failed.
D_DECRYPT_ERROR.P2_FORGOT_PW: If you forgot your password, enter the correct password and click "Retry Decrypt".
D_DECRYPT_ERROR.P3_PW_CHANGED: If you changed your password on another device, enter your new password and click "Overwrite Remote". This will upload your local data to the server.

D_ENTER_PASSWORD.TITLE: Encryption Password Required
D_ENTER_PASSWORD.MESSAGE: The sync server contains encrypted data, but no encryption password is configured on this device. Please enter your encryption password to decrypt and sync your data.
D_ENTER_PASSWORD.FORCE_OVERWRITE_INFO: If you don‚Äôt know the old password, you can overwrite the server with your local data and a new password.
D_ENTER_PASSWORD.FORCE_OVERWRITE_CONFIRM: This will delete all data on the server and upload your local data with the new password. Unsynced local changes may be lost. Continue?

D_FRESH_CLIENT_CONFIRM.MESSAGE: This appears to be a fresh installation. Remote data with {{count}} changes was found. Do you want to download and apply this data?
D_FRESH_CLIENT_CONFIRM.TITLE: Initial Sync

D_SYNC_IMPORT_CONFLICT.TITLE: Sync Conflict Detected
D_SYNC_IMPORT_CONFLICT.MESSAGE: Your local data was imported/restored, but the server has {{filteredOpCount}} changes from other devices.
D_SYNC_IMPORT_CONFLICT.EXPLANATION: These changes were made without knowledge of your import and cannot be automatically merged.

D_LOCAL_DATA_REPLACE_CONFIRM.MESSAGE: You have {{count}} unsynced local changes that will be replaced by remote data. Do you want to continue?
D_LOCAL_DATA_REPLACE_CONFIRM.TITLE: Replace Local Data?

D_INCOMPLETE_SYNC.P1: The remote sync data is incoherent!
D_INCOMPLETE_SYNC.T2: Your archive data was not properly uploaded during last sync:
D_INCOMPLETE_SYNC.T4: 1. Go to your other device and complete the sync there.
D_INCOMPLETE_SYNC.T5:
2. Or you can overwrite the remote data with your local one. All remote changes will
    be lost!
D_INCOMPLETE_SYNC.T6: Creating a backup of the data you overwrite is recommended!!!

D_PERMISSION.TEXT: Your file permission for local syncing has been revoked.
D_PERMISSION.TITLE: Sync: Local file permission denied

D_RESTORE.TITLE: Restore from History
D_RESTORE.NO_POINTS: No restore points available. Restore points are created when you sync or import data.
D_RESTORE.INTRO: Select a point in time to restore your data to:
D_RESTORE.WARNING: This will replace ALL your current data with the selected backup. This action cannot be undone!
D_RESTORE.CONFIRM_MSG:
Are you absolutely sure you want to restore to {{timestamp}}?

This will completely replace all your current data and cannot be undone.

DROPBOX.INFO_TEXT: Dropbox authentication uses OAuth. Click the button below to authenticate with your Dropbox account.
DROPBOX.STATUS_CONFIGURED: Dropbox is configured and ready to sync
DROPBOX.STATUS_NOT_CONFIGURED: Not configured - authenticate to enable sync

LOCAL_FILE.INFO_TEXT: Local file sync stores data in a folder on your device. Important: Do not use file syncing tools like Syncthing, Resilio, or similar to sync this folder between devices - they can cause conflicts. For multi-device sync, use WebDAV, Dropbox, or SuperSync instead.

SUPER_SYNC.INFO_TEXT: SuperSync keeps your tasks synchronized across all your devices in real-time. Your data is stored securely on the sync server. Note: SuperSync is currently in Beta.
SUPER_SYNC.SERVER_URL_DESCRIPTION: Leave as-is for the official server, or enter a custom server URL
SUPER_SYNC.LOGIN_INSTRUCTIONS: Click the button below to open the server login page. After logging in, copy your access token and paste it here.
SUPER_SYNC.ACCESS_TOKEN_DESCRIPTION: Paste the token you copied from the server login page
SUPER_SYNC.E2E_ENCRYPTION_DESCRIPTION: Will be slower, but more secure
SUPER_SYNC.ENCRYPTION_WARNING: WARNING: If you forget your encryption password, your data cannot be recovered. This password is separate from your login password. You must use the same password on all devices.
SUPER_SYNC.CHANGE_PASSWORD_WARNING: WARNING: This will permanently delete ALL sync history and backups on the server. Previous versions cannot be recovered. Your current data will be re-uploaded with the new password. All other devices will need the new password.
SUPER_SYNC.FORCE_OVERWRITE_INFO: If you can't sync because you don't know the current encryption password, you can overwrite the server with your local data and a new password.
SUPER_SYNC.FORCE_OVERWRITE_CONFIRM: This will delete all data on the server and upload your local data with the new password. Unsynced local changes may be lost. Are you sure you want to continue?
SUPER_SYNC.PASSWORD_MIN_LENGTH: Password must be at least 8 characters
SUPER_SYNC.REMOVE_ENCRYPTION_WARNING: Removing encryption will delete all server data and re-upload your data without encryption. All devices will need to reconfigure.
SUPER_SYNC.DISABLE_ENCRYPTION_WARNING: WARNING: This will permanently delete ALL encrypted sync data on the server. This is necessary because encrypted operations cannot be mixed with unencrypted ones.
SUPER_SYNC.DISABLE_ENCRYPTION_ITEM_1: All sync history and backups on the server will be deleted
SUPER_SYNC.DISABLE_ENCRYPTION_ITEM_2: Your current data will be re-uploaded without encryption
SUPER_SYNC.DISABLE_ENCRYPTION_ITEM_3: All other devices will sync the unencrypted data
SUPER_SYNC.DISABLE_ENCRYPTION_NOTE: Your local data will NOT be deleted. You can re-enable encryption at any time.
SUPER_SYNC.DISABLE_ENCRYPTION_NOT_READY: Sync is not enabled or configured.
SUPER_SYNC.DISABLE_ENCRYPTION_SUPERSYNC_ONLY: This feature is only available for SuperSync.
SUPER_SYNC.DISABLE_ENCRYPTION_ENABLE_FIRST: Please enable sync and save your SuperSync configuration first, then try again.
SUPER_SYNC.ENABLE_ENCRYPTION_WARNING: WARNING: This will permanently delete ALL unencrypted sync data on the server. This is necessary because encrypted operations cannot be mixed with unencrypted ones. If you forget your encryption password, your data cannot be recovered.
SUPER_SYNC.ENABLE_ENCRYPTION_ITEM_1: All sync history and backups on the server will be deleted
SUPER_SYNC.ENABLE_ENCRYPTION_ITEM_2: Your current data will be re-uploaded with encryption
SUPER_SYNC.ENABLE_ENCRYPTION_ITEM_3: All other devices will need to enter this encryption password
SUPER_SYNC.ENABLE_ENCRYPTION_NOTE: Your local data will NOT be deleted. You can disable encryption at any time.
SUPER_SYNC.ENABLE_ENCRYPTION_NOT_READY: Sync is not enabled or configured.
SUPER_SYNC.ENABLE_ENCRYPTION_SUPERSYNC_ONLY: This feature is only available for SuperSync.
SUPER_SYNC.ENABLE_ENCRYPTION_PASSWORD_REQUIRED: Please enter an encryption password first.

IMPORT_ENCRYPTION_WARNING.TITLE: Encryption Settings Will Change
IMPORT_ENCRYPTION_WARNING.WARNING_TEXT: The backup you are importing has different encryption settings. Encrypted and unencrypted data cannot coexist on the server, so all server data must be deleted.
IMPORT_ENCRYPTION_WARNING.ITEM_1: All sync history and backups on the server will be permanently deleted
IMPORT_ENCRYPTION_WARNING.ITEM_2: Your imported data will be uploaded with the new encryption settings
IMPORT_ENCRYPTION_WARNING.ITEM_3: All other devices must sync and update their encryption settings to match
IMPORT_ENCRYPTION_WARNING.NOTE_ENABLING: Important: Encryption requires a password. If you forget this password, your data CANNOT be recovered!
IMPORT_ENCRYPTION_WARNING.NOTE_DISABLING: Important: Without encryption, anyone with access to your sync server can read your data.
IMPORT_ENCRYPTION_WARNING.NOTE: Your local data will be replaced with the imported data regardless of this choice.

FORM.L_ENABLE_ENCRYPTION: Enable end-to-end encryption (experimental) ‚Äì Keep your data private from your sync provider
FORM.L_ENCRYPTION_NOTES: IMPORTANT NOTES: You will need to set the same password on your other devices BEFORE the next sync for everything to work. Please select a password that is secure. Please note that you will NOT be able to access your data, if you forget this password! There is NO recovery possible, since only you have the key. The encryption will probably be good enough to thwart most attacks, but there is no guarantee.
FORM.TITLE: Sync

FILE_BASED.CHANGE_PASSWORD_WARNING: WARNING: This will re-upload your data with the new password. All other devices will need the new password before syncing.
FILE_BASED.PASSWORD_MIN_LENGTH: Password must be at least 8 characters
FILE_BASED.REMOVE_ENCRYPTION_WARNING: Removing encryption will re-upload your data without encryption. All devices will need to reconfigure.
FILE_BASED.DISABLE_ENCRYPTION_WARNING: WARNING: This will re-upload your data without encryption.
FILE_BASED.DISABLE_ENCRYPTION_ITEM_1: Your current data will be re-uploaded without encryption
FILE_BASED.DISABLE_ENCRYPTION_ITEM_2: All other devices will sync the unencrypted data
FILE_BASED.DISABLE_ENCRYPTION_ITEM_3: You can re-enable encryption at any time
FILE_BASED.DISABLE_ENCRYPTION_NOTE: Your local data will NOT be deleted.
FILE_BASED.ENABLE_ENCRYPTION_WARNING: WARNING: This will re-upload your data with encryption. If you forget your encryption password, your data cannot be recovered.
FILE_BASED.ENABLE_ENCRYPTION_ITEM_1: Your current data will be re-uploaded with encryption
FILE_BASED.ENABLE_ENCRYPTION_ITEM_2: All other devices will need this encryption password
FILE_BASED.ENABLE_ENCRYPTION_ITEM_3: You can disable encryption at any time
FILE_BASED.ENABLE_ENCRYPTION_NOTE: Your local data will NOT be deleted.
FILE_BASED.ENABLE_ENCRYPTION_NOT_READY: Sync is not enabled or configured.
FILE_BASED.ENABLE_ENCRYPTION_FILE_BASED_ONLY: This feature is only available for file-based sync providers.
FILE_BASED.ENABLE_ENCRYPTION_PASSWORD_REQUIRED: Please enter an encryption password first.

WEB_DAV.CORS_INFO: Making it work in a web browser: Allow Super Productivity to make CORS requests to your WebDAV server. This can have negative security implications! For Nextcloud, please refer to this GitHub thread for more information. One approach to make this work on mobile is allowing "https://app.super-productivity.com" via the Nextcloud app webapppassword. Use at your own risk!
WEB_DAV.D_SYNC_FOLDER_PATH: Path relative to the WebDAV server root where sync files will be stored (e.g. '/super-productivity' or '/'). This is NOT your server's internal directory path.
WEB_DAV.INFO: WebDAV implementations differ wildly unfortunately. Super Productivity is known to work well with Nextcloud, but it may not work with your provider.
WEB_DAV.S_FILL_ALL_FIELDS: Please fill in all WebDAV fields first
WEB_DAV.CONDITIONAL_HEADER_WARNING_MSG:
Your WebDAV server does not support conditional headers (If-Unmodified-Since). This means Super Productivity cannot detect concurrent changes from other devices during upload.

Sync will still work, but there is a small risk of data conflicts if you make changes on multiple devices simultaneously.

S.CLOCK_DRIFT_WARNING: Your device clock appears to be off by {{minutes}} minutes. This may cause sync issues.
S.COMPACTION_FAILED: Database cleanup failed. App may slow down.
S.CONFLICT_RESOLUTION_FAILED: Sync conflict resolution failed. Please reload.
S.DIALOG_RESULT_ERROR: An error occurred while processing the sync dialog. Please try again.
S.CONFLICT_DIALOG_TIMEOUT: Sync conflict dialog timed out and was cancelled. Sync will retry on next trigger.
S.OPERATION_PERMANENTLY_FAILED: Some sync operations failed and could not be applied. Data may be incomplete.
S.ERROR_CORS:
WebDAV Sync Error: Network request failed.

This may be a CORS issue. Please ensure:
‚Ä¢ Your WebDAV server allows Cross-Origin requests
‚Ä¢ The server URL is correct and accessible
‚Ä¢ You have a working internet connection
S.ERROR_DATA_IS_CURRENTLY_WRITTEN: Remote Data is currently being written
S.ERROR_PERMISSION: File access denied. Please check your filesystem permissions.
S.ERROR_PERMISSION_FLATPAK: File access denied. Grant filesystem permission via Flatseal or use a path inside ~/.var/app/
S.ERROR_PERMISSION_SNAP: File access denied. Run 'snap connect super-productivity:home' or use a path inside ~/snap/super-productivity/common/
S.ERROR_UNABLE_TO_READ_REMOTE_DATA: Error while syncing. Unable to read remote data. Maybe you enabled encryption and your local password does not match the one used to encrypt the remote data?
S.HYDRATION_FAILED: Failed to load data. Please reload the app.
S.INTEGRITY_CHECK_FAILED: Data integrity issue detected. Auto-repair attempted. If you experience issues, please reload the app.
S.INCOMPLETE_CFG: Authentication for sync failed. Please check your config!
S.INCOMPLETE_OP_SYNC: Sync incomplete: {{count}} operation file(s) failed to download
S.TOO_MANY_OPS_TO_DOWNLOAD: Too many sync operations to download. Some changes may be missing.
S.INVALID_OPERATION_PAYLOAD: Invalid operation detected. Changes may not be saved - please reload.
S.DECRYPTION_FAILED: Failed to decrypt synced data. Please check your encryption password.
S.ENCRYPTION_PASSWORD_REQUIRED: Encrypted data received but no encryption password is configured. Please set your encryption password in sync settings.
S.ENCRYPTION_DISABLED_ON_OTHER_DEVICE: Encryption was disabled on another device. Your sync settings have been updated.
S.WEB_CRYPTO_NOT_AVAILABLE: Encryption is not available on this device. On Android, encryption requires a secure context (HTTPS) which is not available. Please disable encryption in sync settings or sync from a desktop web browser.
S.PERSIST_FAILED: Failed to save changes. State may be inconsistent - please reload.
S.DEFERRED_ACTION_FAILED: Some changes made during sync could not be saved. Please reload to recover.
S.REMOTE_DATA_TOO_OLD: Remote data is too old to be processed. Please update your remote app.
S.STORAGE_QUOTA_EXCEEDED: Sync server storage is full. Your changes are NOT syncing! Please archive old tasks or upgrade your plan.
S.STORAGE_RECOVERED_AFTER_COMPACTION: Storage was running low. Old data cleaned up successfully.
S.ERROR_PAYLOAD_TOO_LARGE:
Sync Error: Your data is too large to upload.

This happens when you have many archived tasks. Your data was NOT synced!

Please contact support for assistance.
S.UPLOAD_OPS_REJECTED: {{count}} operation(s) were permanently rejected by the server and won't be synced.
S.VERSION_TOO_OLD: Your app version is too old for the synced data. Please update!
S.VERSION_UNSUPPORTED: Cannot sync: data requires a newer app version. Please update.
S.NEWER_VERSION_AVAILABLE: Some changes are from a newer app version. Consider updating for full compatibility.
S.FRESH_CLIENT_SYNC_CANCELLED: Initial sync cancelled. Remote data was not applied.
S.LOCAL_DATA_REPLACE_CANCELLED: Sync cancelled. Your local data has been preserved.
S.PARTIAL_APPLY_FAILURE: Some sync operations failed to apply. Data has been validated.
S.REPLAY_LOCAL_OPS_FAILED: Failed to replay local operations after import. Some recent changes may be lost. Data has been validated.
S.ARCHIVE_OPERATION_FAILED: Archive operation failed. Some cleanup may not have completed.
S.LWW_CONFLICTS_AUTO_RESOLVED: Sync conflicts auto-resolved: {{localWins}} local win(s), {{remoteWins}} remote win(s)
S.LOCAL_CHANGES_DISCARDED: {{count}} local change(s) discarded - item(s) were deleted on another device
S.LOCAL_CHANGES_DISCARDED_SNAPSHOT: {{count}} unsaved local change(s) discarded - sync downloaded newer data
S.FINISH_DAY_SYNC_ERROR: Sync error while finishing day. Please try again.
S.SERVER_MIGRATION_VALIDATION_FAILED: Could not migrate data to server - local data validation failed. Please try importing a backup.
S.MIGRATION_FAILED: Some sync data could not be migrated and was skipped. This may indicate data corruption or a bug.
S.VECTOR_CLOCK_LIMIT_REACHED: Sync has tracked {{originalSize}} devices/browsers, exceeding the limit of {{maxSize}}. Inactive device entries were pruned. Consider a sync reset if you experience issues.

D_DATA_REPAIRED.TITLE: Data Repair Executed
D_DATA_REPAIRED.MSG: Your data required automatic repair ({{count}} issues fixed). This should not normally happen. If this occurs repeatedly, please report it.

D_DATA_REPAIR_CONFIRM.TITLE: Data Damage Detected
D_DATA_REPAIR_CONFIRM.MSG: Your data appears to be damaged. Would you like to attempt automatic repair? This may result in minor data loss.

SAFETY_BACKUP.DESCRIPTION: Automatic backups are created before downloading data from remote during sync operations. Backups are organized in 4 smart slots: 2 most recent, 1 first from today, and 1 first from a day before today.
SAFETY_BACKUP.NO_BACKUPS: No safety backups available yet. Backups are created automatically before sync operations.
SAFETY_BACKUP.TOOLTIP_CREATE_MANUAL: Create a manual backup of all your data
SAFETY_BACKUP.TOOLTIP_RESTORE: Restore this backup (will replace all current data)

S.CANNOT_ASSIGN_PROJECT_FOR_REPEATABLE_TAS: Cannot assign a project via short syntax for recurring tasks!

D_CONFIRM_MOVE_TO_PROJECT.MSG: There are {{tasksNr}} instances created for this recurring task. Do you want to move all of them to the project "{{projectName}}"?

D_CONFIRM_REMOVE.MSG: Removing the recurring config will convert all previous instances of this task to just regular tasks. Are you sure you want to proceed?

D_CONFIRM_UPDATE_INSTANCES.MSG: There are {{tasksNr}} instances created for this recurring task. Do you want to update all of them with the new defaults or just future tasks?

D_DELETE_INSTANCE.MSG: Remove the recurring task instance on {{date}}? This will prevent the task from being created on this date only.

D_EDIT.HELP1: Recurring tasks are meant for daily chores, e.g. "Organization", "Daily Meeting", "Code Review", "Checking emails" or similar tasks which are likely to occur again and again.
D_EDIT.HELP2: Once configured, a recurring task will be recreated on every day selected below as soon as you open your project and will be automatically marked as completed at the end of the day. They will be handled as different instances. So you can freely add subtasks etc.
D_EDIT.HELP3: Tasks imported from Jira or Git Issues cannot be recurring.
D_EDIT.HELP4: The 'Order' field refers to the creation order recurring tasks. It is only in effect for recurring tasks that are created at the same time. A lower value means a task will be higher up the list; a higher number means that it will be further down. A value greater than 0 means items are created at the bottom of normal tasks.

F.DISABLE_AUTO_UPDATE_SUBTASKS_DESCRIPTION: Do not update inherited subtasks automatically when the newest instance changes
F.INHERIT_SUBTASKS_DESCRIPTION: When enabled, subtasks from the most recent task instance will be recreated with the recurring task
F.ORDER_DESCRIPTION: Creation order of recurring tasks. Only affects recurring tasks created at the same time. A lower value means a task will be created higher up the list; a higher number means it will be further down. A value greater than 0 means tasks are created below normal tasks.
F.START_TIME_DESCRIPTION: E.g. 15:00. Leave blank for an all day task
F.TITLE: Task title

B_TTR.MSG: You have not been tracking time for {{time}}
B_TTR.MSG_WITHOUT_TIME: You have not been tracking time

D_IDLE.SIMPLE_COUNTER_CONFIRM_TXT: You selected skip, but activated {{nr}} simple counter button(s). Do you want to track the idle time for them?
D_IDLE.SPLIT_TIME: Split time into multiples tasks and breaks
D_IDLE.WARN_SIMPLE_COUNTER: Time will be counted towards the activated simple counter buttons.
D_IDLE.WARN_SIMPLE_COUNTER_BREAK: Time will STILL be counted on the activated simple counter buttons.

G.DURATION_DESCRIPTION: e.g. "5h 23m" which results in 5 hours and 23 minutes
G.EXTENSION_INFO: Please download the Chrome extension to allow communication with the Jira API and Idle Time Handling. Note that this doesn't work for mobile. Without the extension, the features will not work!
G.ICON_INP_DESCRIPTION: All UTF-8 emojis are also supported!

APP_FEATURES.HELP: Enable or disable specific app features across the UI.
APP_FEATURES.TITLE: App Features
APP_FEATURES.USER_PROFILES_HINT: Allows you to create and switch between different user profiles, each with separate settings, tasks, and sync configurations. The profile management button will appear in the top-right corner when enabled. Note: Disabling this feature will hide the UI but preserve your profile data. (Experimental feature. No guarantees. Make sure to have a backup!)

AUTO_BACKUPS.HELP: Automatically save all data to your app folder to have it ready if something goes wrong.

CALENDARS.BROWSER_WARNING:
Due to cross-origin restrictions this will likely NOT work with the web browser version of Super Productivity.
Please download the desktop version to use this feature!
CALENDARS.CHECK_UPDATES: Check for remote updates every X
CALENDARS.HELP: You can integrate calendars to be reminded and add them as tasks within Super Productivity. The integration works by using the iCal format. For this to work your calendars need to be accessible either over the internet or via file system.
CALENDARS.SHOW_BANNER_THRESHOLD: Show a notification X before the event (blank for disabled)

CLIPBOARD_IMAGES.ERROR_DELETING_ALL: Failed to delete all clipboard images
CLIPBOARD_IMAGES.HELP: Manage images pasted from clipboard. For browser version, images are stored in IndexedDB. For desktop version, configure the storage path.
CLIPBOARD_IMAGES.MANAGE_DESCRIPTION: View and delete images stored from pasting in markdown fields
CLIPBOARD_IMAGES.PATH_DESCRIPTION: Configure where clipboard images are stored on your filesystem (leave empty for default location)

FOCUS_MODE.HELP: Focus mode opens a distraction-free screen to help you focus on your current task.
FOCUS_MODE.L_IS_PLAY_TICK: Play ticking sound during focus sessions
FOCUS_MODE.L_START_IN_BACKGROUND: Start focus sessions with banner only (no overlay)
FOCUS_MODE.L_SYNC_SESSION_WITH_TRACKING: Sync focus sessions with time tracking
FOCUS_MODE.TITLE: Focus Mode

IDLE.HELP: When idle time handling is enabled, a dialog will open after a specified amount of time to check if - and on which - task you want to track your time when you have been idle.
IDLE.IS_ONLY_OPEN_IDLE_WHEN_CURRENT_TASK: Only trigger idle time dialog when the current task is selected
IDLE.TITLE: Idle Handling

IMEX.HELP:
Here you can export all your data as JSON for backups, but also to use it in a different context (e.g. you might want to export your projects in the web browser version and import them into the desktop version).

The import expects valid JSON to be copied into the text area. NOTE: Once you press the import button all your current settings and data will be overwritten!
IMEX.TITLE: Import/Export

KEYBOARD.GLOBAL_TOGGLE_TASK_START: Toggle time tracking for last active task
KEYBOARD.GO_TO_WORK_VIEW: Go to Work view and focus first task
KEYBOARD.HELP:
Here you can configure all keyboard shortcuts.

Click on the text input and enter the desired keyboard key or key combination. Press Enter to save or Escape to abort.

There are three types of shortcuts:

  • Global shortcuts: When the app is running it will trigger the action from every other application.
  • Application level shortcuts: Will trigger from every screen of the application, but not if you're currently editing a text field.
  • Task level shortcuts: They will only trigger if you have selected a task via mouse or keyboard and usually trigger an action specifically related to that one task.

Press Escape to remove a shortcut.
KEYBOARD.MOVE_TASK_DOWN: Move task down in the list
KEYBOARD.MOVE_TASK_TO_BOTTOM: Move task to the bottom of the list
KEYBOARD.MOVE_TASK_TO_TOP: Move task to the top of the list
KEYBOARD.MOVE_TASK_UP: Move task up in the list
KEYBOARD.MOVE_TO_REGULARS_TASKS: Move task to Today's task list
KEYBOARD.TASK_MOVE_TO_PROJECT: Open move task to project menu
KEYBOARD.TASK_SHORTCUTS_INFO: The following shortcuts apply to the currently selected task (selected via tab or mouse).
KEYBOARD.TITLE: Keyboard Shortcuts

REMINDER.USE_ALARM_STYLE_REMINDERS_DESCRIPTION: When enabled, reminders use louder alarm sounds and more intrusive notifications. Recommended for critical reminders.

SCHEDULE.HELP: The schedule feature provides you with a quick overview over how your planned tasks play out over time. You can find it in the left hand menu under 'Schedule'.

PLUGINS.RECOMMENDATION: Only install plugins from trusted sources and review their code if possible. Always backup your data before installing new plugins!
PLUGINS.REMEMBER_CHOICE: Remember my choice for this plugin
PLUGINS.RISK_DATA_ACCESS: Plugins can read, modify, and delete ALL your tasks, projects, and personal data
PLUGINS.RISK_MALICIOUS_CODE: Malicious plugins could steal sensitive information or corrupt your data
PLUGINS.RISK_PERFORMANCE: Poorly written plugins may cause performance issues or crashes
PLUGINS.RISK_SYSTEM_ACCESS: Desktop plugins with Node.js permissions can execute system commands
PLUGINS.SECURITY_WARNING: Plugins have significant access to your data and system. Installing untrusted plugins poses serious security risks:
PLUGINS.SIDE_PANEL_LABEL_REQUIRED: Side panel button label is required
PLUGINS.SIDE_PANEL_ONCLICK_REQUIRED: Side panel button onClick handler is required

SCHEDULE.NO_REPEATABLE_TASKS: There are currently no recurring tasks. You can schedule a task by choosing "Recur" in the task's side panel. To open the side panel, click on the rightmost icon that appears when hovering over a task (or just tap on the task on mobile).
SCHEDULE.NO_SCHEDULED: There are currently no scheduled tasks of this type. You can schedule a task by choosing "Schedule Task" in the task's context menu. To open it, right-click (long press on mobile) on a task.

V.E_DATETIME: The entered value is not a datetime!
V.E_MIN_LENGTH: Must be at least {{val}} characters long

WW.ADD_SOME_TASKS: Add some tasks to plan your day!
WW.DONE_TASKS_IN_ARCHIVE: There are currently no completed tasks here, but there are some already archived.
WW.FINISH_DAY_TOOLTIP: Evaluate your day, move all completed tasks to the archive (optionally) and/or plan your next day.
WW.NO_DONE_TASKS: There are currently no completed tasks
WW.WORKING_TODAY_ARCHIVED: Time worked today on archived tasks
